body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install boost
...
A C++11 capable compiler is required for building the B2 engine.
Toolset 'gcc' does not appear to support C++11.

> g++ -x c++ -std=c++11  check_cxx11.cpp
cc1plus: error: unrecognized command line option "-std=c++11"
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3480-e0017a6666
* **Python:** 2.6.9
* **Platform:** cray-suse_linux11-bulldozer
* **Concretizer:** original

### Additional information

* [spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6804413/spack-build-out.txt)
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6804414/spack-build-env.txt)

@hainest 

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: boost
